data.text:
Revenue and spending rules must be flexible so that governments can deal with unexpected shocks, but an escape clause should set clear boundaries, writes 
Felipe Larraín Bascuñan in F&D. https://t.co/ww8C4tqavj https://t.co/qrlz3SwPaW

Ever since mobile money was launched in Africa in 2007, it has revolutionized financial inclusion for people without bank accounts. But does mobile money count as money in the economy? https://t.co/DYSA3H9GG5 https://t.co/iVp2smpaTy

25 years after the Asian financial crisis, one important lesson is that countries can never be overprepared to tackle shocks, explains AMRO's chief economist Hoe Ee Khor, as he reflects on the crisis and the region’s current challenges in F&D. https://t.co/zYVulJClwT https://t.co/detxMBJ0Nc

Growth is slowing in Asia, where policymakers face difficult trade-offs. They should protect the vulnerable from rising fuel and food costs, and enact economic reforms to boost long-term growth. IMF Blog has more: https://t.co/jHhSbVTm97 https://t.co/zlwKJ7zSlL

Watch our Analyze This videos to find out how the war in Ukraine has affected commodity prices and the global economic system, as well as the risks ahead. https://t.co/dMTDiyg5pM https://t.co/dtPBDtoFRi

🇰🇷Korea’s economic expansion will slow to 2.5% this year and accelerate to 2.9% next year, our latest projections show. Inflation and unemployment, particularly for young people, are both forecast to decrease next year. https://t.co/hGqxkTP3Ap https://t.co/y7enuKuRfz

🇰🇷Korea's economy remains resilient, but Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and related sanctions have exacerbated concerns about the risks of stagflation. Our new Country Focus blog has more. https://t.co/hGqxkTP3Ap https://t.co/vcEi11UBNf

🇰🇷Korea's economic recovery has been resilient, but inflation, war in Ukraine, and developments in China are dimming the outlook for growth and exports. See our new County Focus blog for more. https://t.co/hGqxkTP3Ap https://t.co/Ixe8usOT1L

Revenue and spending rules must be flexible so that governments can deal with unexpected shocks, but an escape clause should set clear boundaries, writes @felipelarrain in F&D. https://t.co/ww8C4t8zDL https://t.co/VMg2GEWhUR

Deputy Managing Director Kenji Okamura met today with ASEAN+3 officials to discuss a range of economic challenges facing the region, and how best to tackle them amid slowing global growth and increasing inflation. https://t.co/6jOs9ijIR3

25 years after the Asian financial crisis, one important lesson is that countries can never be overprepared to tackle shocks, explains @amro_asia chief economist Hoe Ee Khor, as he reflects on the crisis and the region’s current challenges in F&D. https://t.co/zYVulJClwT https://t.co/L5yD4g39ew

Spikes in commodity prices, imbalances in supply and demand, and a shortage of workers are among the main factors shaping the outlook for inflation. Swipe to read more about each. https://t.co/1YR5D7qsj8 #IMFBlog

Governments can use digital technology, such as mobile money or smart cards, to better target social transfers, as Togo did during the pandemic. https://t.co/CWu4VbrHZz #IMFBlog https://t.co/2WVI8Nq25Z

In the United States and some European countries, inflation has reached its highest level in more than 40 years. It’s expected to persist for longer than previously expected. More on IMF Blog. https://t.co/SFp7kGgvom https://t.co/4GfNBnuzRt

Most emerging and developing countries are grappling with the economic fallout of the war and the long-term damage to their economies from the pandemic. The divergence that opened up in 2021 with advanced economies is expected to persist. https://t.co/SFp7kFYUwO https://t.co/Sfk0radgiN

In an interview with F&D, @amro_asia Chief Economist Hoe Ee Khor reflects on the lessons from the Asian Financial Crisis, how Asian economies have fared in the pandemic, and more. https://t.co/zYVulJClwT https://t.co/isQPddW22s

IMF staff and 🇪🇨 Ecuador reached a staff-level agreement on the combined 4th & 5th reviews under the Extended Fund Facility-supported program. Find out more: https://t.co/b1LnYooD99 https://t.co/r7MsWm9Yfs

Economist Dr. Lisa D. Cook’s research is a clarion call to integrate not only diversity of thought but also diversity of lived experience into economics and the world beyond. Check out the profile of the new Federal Reserve Board governor on F&D. https://t.co/iN8Tvlm9tj https://t.co/yHHxCvzXIX

Let’s embrace diverse forms of money, says @KGeorgieva. A public digital platform could be a source of innovation, connecting various forms of money: from commercial bank deposits, to central bank digital currencies, to some stablecoin arrangements.

🔗 https://t.co/5mdDjEc9Ib https://t.co/dNQLbtsNb7

Economist Dr. Lisa D. Cook was confirmed to serve on the US Federal Reserve’s Board of Governors. @drlisadcook’s work demonstrates how racism and sexism stifle innovation and economic growth. Check out her profile in F&D. https://t.co/iN8Tvlm9tj https://t.co/xe3cATn5BM

Crypto assets might be used to circumvent capital flow management measures. New IMF research, published today, calls for comprehensive & coordinated global regulation in this area. Read the note here: https://t.co/Pxq47eHtG4 https://t.co/7qjxZ8pkld

Geopolitical risks are up: some countries may consider developing parallel, disjointed payment systems to mitigate the risk of potential economic sanctions. Such ‘payment blocs’ would only worsen the impact of ‘economic blocs’, says IMF chief at @SNB_BNS.

https://t.co/5mdDjEc9Ib https://t.co/QTpYl5puHY

.@KGeorgieva says the war in Ukraine has sharply increased the risk of economic fragmentation. A possible solution? Develop a public digital platform to modernize cross-border payments, making them more efficient, safer, more inclusive. Watch the speech: https://t.co/qbeTWiGHyq https://t.co/Gqkr5mOr0r

STARTING NOW: Tune in for the Managing Director’s remarks on  confronting fragmentation of international payments at the 10th High-Level Conference on the International Monetary System at @SNB_BNS.

🔗 https://t.co/RMHhTbXo11 https://t.co/7llEKjNwsF

A policy package including a green infrastructure and R&D investment push, higher carbon prices, income support for low-income workers, and training can move the economy toward net-zero emissions. More in our latest World Economic Outlook research. https://t.co/PNkVHprMMG https://t.co/6C63WWigjj

The impact of surging oil and gas prices has varied across emerging markets. Watch our Analyze This videos to learn more and find out how the war has affected the global economy. https://t.co/lfhdnIaMvl https://t.co/IPRvjp3J1E

IMF DMD Bo Li at @FATFNews event: The pandemic highlighted the importance of ensuring the integrity of government spending. The need to safeguard the integrity of the financial system & to ensure that crime does not undermine growth is more acute today. https://t.co/71h34bV1lZ https://t.co/Blqs540Ri0

The probability of people moving from pollution-intensive to greener jobs is between 4% and 7%. The right policies can help people shift to greener jobs and help ease the move for workers. More in this #IMFBlog. https://t.co/P6CX1iNtjf https://t.co/n9HwWuorPh

📢 Call for papers for the 3rd joint annual workshop on international capital flows and financial policies organized by the IMF, @bankofengland, @banquedefrance, @bancaditalia, and @OECD. All details here: https://t.co/LIgJYYNMyC 
📅 Deadline: June 30, 2022

Governments can help fill information gaps in supply chains, invest in trade and digital infrastructure, reduce trade costs, and minimize policy uncertainty. Our latest research offers advice on improving global trade and value chains. https://t.co/Dj6N70nM2m https://t.co/L6CH2sUcz3

For Pakistan to survive climate change, it needs to protect its forests. But deforestation levels in the country have reached a record high. So, the 10 Billion Tree Tsunami was born. https://t.co/LfQEi7owNv

Beyond the humanitarian crisis of the war in Ukraine, all the world’s regions will experience slower growth and faster inflation. Higher food and energy costs will be one of the main channels of the global impact, which we lay out on IMF Blog. https://t.co/LY1urh4vrj https://t.co/angxNWUsAJ

Poorer countries face greater risks from climate change. Learn why in our latest Charts in Motion. You can also read more about the unequal costs of climate change here. https://t.co/qqXH1yZ9sD https://t.co/hT6uuIdtQp

The war in Ukraine is costing lives and hitting the global economy. In this new World Economic Outlook video, find out how much this will affect global growth and what policymakers can do. https://t.co/J6EVpjOcP3 https://t.co/s4gfTep3tf
Can policymakers target lower, or even zero, inflation in the long term? Read more in #FandD. https://t.co/oBclWJtlVw https://t.co/jR2KNlJPcE

The impact of surging oil and gas prices has varied across emerging markets. Watch our Analyze This videos to learn more and find out how the war has affected the global economy. https://t.co/dMTDiyg5pM https://t.co/WTpTAHaREw

The impact of the global rise in commodity prices varies across sub-Saharan Africa. While rising fuel prices may result in revenue gains for oil-exporting countries, they undermine the finances of oil-importing countries. https://t.co/zYZ4uw42rk https://t.co/21AkqSlveE

Spikes in commodity prices, imbalances in supply and demand, and a shortage of workers are among the main factors shaping the outlook for inflation. Swipe to read more about each. https://t.co/1YR5D7qsj8 #IMFBlog

Princeton’s @MarkusEconomist shares how countries can build resilience to shocks that may materialize in the future. Watch the the latest IMF #FiscalForum discussion w/@pogourinchas, @MamtaMurthi, @rcerdan, @AustinDemby & @Ministere_Sante 
Learn more: 
https://t.co/D75TcxMfi0 https://t.co/RALFGNJEwy

Watch our Analyze This videos to find out how the war in Ukraine has affected commodity prices and the global economic system, as well as the risks ahead. https://t.co/jTmd7H9ocH https://t.co/Xyq4OPwE4B

To respond to this crisis, Europe & the international community must: 1) help countries affected by the war in Ukraine, 2) keep fighting COVID worldwide & 3) act decisively to stem inflation.  
 
Watch her speech: https://t.co/QMWS3WemSP https://t.co/YD4yiuPDHz
What is unemployment? https://t.co/kGB0Uom1lW https://t.co/wx0TrtezVD
The war in Ukraine has created economic shockwaves around the world. Learn more about the impact on global economics and finance here. https://t.co/dMTDiyg5pM https://t.co/RLbrllcQk1

LIVE: IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva delivers keynote speech on the global economic outlook and policies for a post-pandemic Europe in the midst of war at the “#GlobalEuropeSeminar : Uncertain Future and the Transformative Power of Crises”.  
 
Tune in: https://t.co/6dwNGORbcv https://t.co/YDHj4HkKax

Memories of 1970s high inflation and slow growth—known as stagflation—have fueled concerns about a possible repeat today. But today’s global economy relies much less on oil than it did decades ago, easing the effects of a crude price shock. https://t.co/m2pe8v32YU https://t.co/G5JbHZH8h7

Save the date and join IMF Chief @KGeorgieva to discuss how to confront fragmentation of the international payment system at the @SNB_BNS. 

Tune in here: https://t.co/RMHhTbXo11 https://t.co/Cgx98PmzNj
Inequality is worsening. Fiscal policy can affect inequality, before and after it develops. Learn more in F&D. https://t.co/NJNosKJOtA https://t.co/BnW87eFv5y

What happens when there are plenty of jobs, but not enough people wanting them? The IMF's Myrto Oikonomou and Ippei Shibata explain why workers are scarce, despite plenty of vacancies: https://t.co/wIlMb0dkx6 https://t.co/nLQlRF0H59

SAVE THE DATE: IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva will discuss the global economic outlook and policies for prosperity at the “#GlobalEuropeSeminar: Uncertain Future and the Transformative Power of Crises” on May 6 .    
https://t.co/JSoCZCfEHL https://t.co/0R4wasxqUG

Nowadays, policymakers have a large toolkit at their disposal to promote gender equality and support inclusive growth. But where does tax policy fit in? The IMF's Maria Coelho explains: https://t.co/V2PTZXv5Zu https://t.co/p3n0FisaCD
The #WarInUkraine is affecting oil-importers and oil-exporters in the Middle East and North Africa in different ways. The IMF’s Jihad Azour explains: https://t.co/7t4guG3rjX

Rising oil prices may echo the 1970s, when prices spiked on geopolitical tensions, but the global economy relies less on oil now. See our latest IMF Blog for more about how this reduced reliance helps to insulate the world from price shocks. https://t.co/lh4eXqnyGR https://t.co/Jln4BU6NXa

When it comes to preparing for future public health shocks, it’s now or never, says the @WorldBank’s Mamta Murtha. Hear what she, @pogourinchas, @MarkusEconomist, @rcerdan, @AustinDemby & @Ministere_Sante had to say at the IMF's #FiscalForum. Learn more: 
https://t.co/D75TcxMfi0 https://t.co/E4j7RVLPK6

There’s an African proverb: “We desire to bequeath two things to our children; the first one is roots, the other is wings.” Watch this short video of the IMF's Rasmane Ouedraogo discuss new research on social mobility in Africa: https://t.co/SAm9IZp0h7 https://t.co/ZLfkCMWREL

We project inflation in 2022 at 5.7% in advanced economies and 8.6% in emerging market and development economies—1.8 and 2.7 percentage points higher than projected in January. Our analysis here: https://t.co/SFp7kFYUwO https://t.co/n6D6z7EWJv

As a whole, the Middle East and North Africa region’s economies grew by 5.8% in 2021. But inflation also surged to 14.8% and will remain high in 2022. See how this will affect commodity importers by reading our latest Regional Economic Outlook: https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/uHyJwTqbgw
How do we help people move from pollution-intensive jobs to green ones? The IMF’s Katharina Bergant explains: https://t.co/PCU0pWqK1X https://t.co/LDpFiaxYtG

Chile’s former finance minister reveals how the country’s fiscal rule helped avoid the worst of the pandemic. Watch Rodrigo Cerda in the latest IMF #FiscalForum

Learn more:
https://t.co/D75TcxMfi0 https://t.co/vMCzCArVnM

Chile’s 🇨🇱 former finance minister reveals how the country’s fiscal rule helped avoid the worst of the pandemic. Watch @rcerdan in the latest IMF #FiscalForum w/ @pogourinchas, @MamtaMurthi, @MarkusEconomist, @austindemby & @Ministere_Sante
Learn more: 
https://t.co/D75TcxMfi0 https://t.co/Id0jkmwPcM
What does a green economic transformation mean for the labor market? Diaa Noureldin and Marina Tavares briefly explain: https://t.co/fpL6A9EQlp https://t.co/FZxkXsyz2Q

The IMF's Karla Vasquez and Kika Alex-Okoh analyzed various legal frameworks on debt transparency in 65 countries across 5 continents. This is what they found: https://t.co/DK62ETFv9s https://t.co/PUoWgpP8w1

Living through a public-health crisis shakes young people’s trust in politicians and scientists for years and could make it harder to prevent the next pandemic, write @cevatgirayaksoy, @B_Eichengreen and @_OrkunSaka in a new article for #FandD. https://t.co/5ODG82az1L https://t.co/9GCthfhY7V

If factories in Asia can't produce and ship out parts such as microchips, then factories in Europe can't assemble their cars. And so automobiles become more scarce, and customers end up paying more. The IMF's Mariano Spector and Jing Zhou explain: https://t.co/61Zo4I7kJ9 https://t.co/uYul21pzVf

Drawing on Sierra Leone’s 🇸🇱 experience with Ebola, @austindemby stresses the importance of investing in medical research, in the latest IMF #FiscalForum discussion w/@pogourinchas, @MamtaMurthi, @MarkusEconomist, @rcerdan, & @Ministere_Sante
Learn more: 
https://t.co/D75TcxMfi0 https://t.co/lkMKSd3MsU

Research by the IMF's Andras Komaromi and Diego Cerdeiro provide a starting point to measure and compare bottlenecks globally as we rebuild our trade networks and revitalize our economies. Watch the video here: https://t.co/BzvQjVuN8B https://t.co/qh6AUpudk5

Spikes in commodity prices, imbalances in supply and demand, and a shortage of workers are among the main factors shaping the outlook for inflation. Swipe to read more about each. https://t.co/1YR5D7I3aG #IMFBlog

Because of their close ties to Russia, countries in the Caucasus and Central Asia are most impacted by the #UkraineWar. Trade, remittances, tourism, and financial linkages are now in flux.

The IMF's Jihad Azour explains our latest outlook for the region: https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/6VkH2IssWa

The impact of the global rise in commodity prices varies across sub-Saharan Africa. While rising fuel prices may result in revenue gains for oil-exporting countries, they undermine the finances of oil-importing countries. https://t.co/JStBGqhhc4 #IMFAfrica https://t.co/J4MALapQVT

Value-added tax (VAT) has attracted all sorts of criticism. Read more in #FandD’s Back to Basics article from our latest issue: https://t.co/N05esXkoJG

And check out our Back to Basics video on the topic. https://t.co/iFbOHv39dW

How can we quantify the impact of rising shipping costs on global inflation? The IMF's Yan Carrière-Swallow and Daniel Jiménez studied data from 143 countries over the past 3 years. This is what they found: https://t.co/cz2H0T3Tv0 https://t.co/rzmnA0wp0G

New means of payment and digital forms of money are about to go mainstream. Interested in learning more? The IMF's Bidisha Das explains how digitization is transforming the very concept of money: https://t.co/uZvtDM3SlI https://t.co/sk3Htk350L
In the Middle East and Central Asia, how has digitalization helped firms mitigate economic losses from the pandemic? The IMF’s Sahra Sakha explains: https://t.co/xxNkh2G1yO https://t.co/lSf8AAMor8

From the #UkraineWar to #COVID, countries in the Middle East and North Africa—especially oil importers—are facing an onslaught of challenges. The IMF’s Jihad Azour presents our latest analysis for the region. https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/yUtfodGrWv

Colombia’s new Flexible Credit Line arrangement will help boost market confidence and provide insurance against external downside risks amidst the war in Ukraine and global inflationary pressures. https://t.co/Ry6H6e08fD https://t.co/YM64Q3izYo

Lockdowns in countries that are trade partners accounted, on average, for up to 60% of the decline in imports in the first half of 2020. Read more on #IMFBlog about how global supply chains adjusted https://t.co/DiVDIcrO80 https://t.co/Jwlm2Fze1p

Economic growth in Asia and the Pacific will slow this year to 4.9%, less than last year’s 6.5% pace, amid the war in Ukraine, a resurgent pandemic, and rising interest rates. Learn more here: https://t.co/9X30FgWZDp  #IMFBlog https://t.co/xdv4pnt2u5

Chief Economist @pogourinchas summarizes the main findings of the latest World Economic Outlook, the risks facing the world, and policy recommendations to improve the economic outlook. https://t.co/J6EVpjOcP3 https://t.co/EL307m1dPv

Our latest Charts in Motion video shows the unequal costs of climate change. Learn more about how the international community can help poor and vulnerable countries adapt here. https://t.co/qqXH1yHy43 https://t.co/3WlxfDn6RM

More diversification in a country’s trade, not less, improves resilience of the economy. Read this #IMFBlog to find out how greater diversification and greater substitutability within global value chains can help lessen the impact of future shocks. https://t.co/HtUArzNGKz https://t.co/hLhnXIxmRi

Higher commodity costs and broader price pressures will cause faster consumer-price increases this year for advanced economies and emerging market and developing economies. Read more in #IMFBlog: https://t.co/q8hIplEUKG https://t.co/ZL5LvEYokv

The surge in global private debt in 2020–13% of GDP–was widespread, faster than during the global financial crisis and almost as large as the rise in public debt. Our latest #WEO looks at the implications for global recovery. https://t.co/eZzuNl9y69 https://t.co/uz6c6EGmJn

The war in Ukraine is costing lives and hitting the global economy. In this new World Economic Outlook video, find out how much this will affect global growth and what policymakers can do. https://t.co/J6EVpjOcP3 https://t.co/2ZURDG9a2W

Sub-Saharan Africa is experiencing yet another shock, which will slow growth to 3.8% in 2022. IMF's @aselassie presents our analysis in the latest Regional Economic Outlook. https://t.co/JStBGpZFNu #IMFAfrica https://t.co/8Bos1mdWrv

IMF research shows that increasing gender diversity on boards in the financial sector is associated with stronger financial outcomes, reduced risk, and greater financial stability. Read more in Deputy Managing Director Antoinette M. Sayeh’s remarks @OMFIF: https://t.co/Nkl8lSj3o4 https://t.co/RJYbVg57lz

We project economic downgrades for all regions. Ending the war in Ukraine, ensuring equitable access to COVID-19 tools, acting on climate change, reigning in inflation, and supporting vulnerable populations can improve the economic outlook. https://t.co/J6EVpjOcP3 https://t.co/UmUiFZWPHJ
What impact will the war in Ukraine have on the global economy? https://t.co/SFp7kFYUwO https://t.co/8djgLcCYKt

Poorer countries face greater risks from climate change. Learn why in our latest Charts in Motion. You can also read more about the unequal costs of climate change here. https://t.co/qqXH1yZ9sD https://t.co/HSW5aoS5Qc

Colombia’s very strong economic fundamentals and institutional policy frameworks combined with a track record of implementing and maintaining such policies qualifies it for a new Flexible Credit Line of US$9.8 billion.

Read more here: https://t.co/Ry6H6e08fD https://t.co/80ibb6xqsd

IMF approves a new two-year precautionary arrangement for Colombia under the Flexible Credit Line of US$9.8 billion designed for crisis prevention.

Full details on our latest press release: https://t.co/Ry6H6eihtL https://t.co/jtLfmyMYof

Spikes in commodity prices, imbalances in supply and demand, and limited supply of labor are among the main factors shaping the inflation outlook as outlined in our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/KIlREkOLhC https://t.co/pmXfURQmZT

To reduce inequality, policymakers must consider both redistribution policies (progressive tax, social assistance), and pre-distribution policies to level the playing field (public education, health, infrastructure). DMD Sayeh's remarks @HarvardCID: https://t.co/omWXko8YlX https://t.co/OWVUTWBkAS

There is no strong evidence that countries can use #DigitalMoney to circumvent sanctions. Find out why ⬇️ 
▶️ Watch the event on new forms of #DigitalMoney: https://t.co/gMGUY97dEp

#IMFMettings
 @KGeorgieva  @BIS_org https://t.co/xEcAOLR9ql
Miss our Spring Meetings last week? Catch up on key takeaways, flagship reports, policy discussions, video highlights and more: https://t.co/C5ZR2K9ay6 https://t.co/FxDtae8dp3

Rising food and energy prices are affecting poor households more. As policymakers strengthen fiscal positions, they must also ensure continued support for the vulnerable. Read Deputy Managing Director Antoinette M. Sayeh’s remarks @HarvardCID here: https://t.co/omWXko8YlX https://t.co/bJ6tFOiNxA
The Chart of the Week takes stock of the latest inflation projections and outlines the four main factors shaping the outlook. #IMFBlog https://t.co/KIlREl6mGc

#CBDC should facilitate financial inclusion and narrow the digital divide. @KGeorgieva and @BIS_org General Manager Agustín Carstens discuss the challenges policymakers need to confront on new forms of #DigitalMoney. ▶️ Watch the event: https://t.co/2s2Nxk2Ra1

#IMFMeetings https://t.co/fIBmLIIkDh

IMF research shows that closing gender gaps can stimulate growth, strengthen economic and financial stability, and reduce income inequality. Read more in Deputy Managing Director Antoinette M. Sayeh’s remarks at @OMFIF: https://t.co/Uw4eoVV5ng https://t.co/CQAdUuvu2o

Join us at 9:00AM ET today where we take stock of the latest research on gender balance in the financial sector with: @OMFIF, @CBKKenya, @Banxico, @ecb and @IFC_org. https://t.co/YnLR5fXfN4 https://t.co/SxIVeJjEjD https://t.co/5fuiY2ydHr

The war in Ukraine has triggered a surge in food and fuel prices, stalling sub-Saharan Africa’s growth. Our latest outlook looks at policies to help countries deal with the current and future crises. https://t.co/JStBGqhhc4 #IMFAfrica https://t.co/HKXTQzuUBP

In 2021, inflation reduced debt-to-GDP ratios in advanced and emerging markets (excluding China) by 1.8 and 4.1 percentage points, respectively. Learn more in the latest #FiscalMonitor #IMFBlog 

https://t.co/gKzxHSJl7k https://t.co/VM3rEbzQVe
